channel.title: How would I go about adding some items?
channel.description:
I've found some black white, red, purple, green, and blue trim armour whilst fiddling around with my Item IDs. (Yay clue scrolls and caskets..)
I was wondering on how I would make them actually, like, work. Not being weapon-equip items, and equip to their appropriate spots.
Also, do I need to add them into Item.cfg? ^^"
This was reposted since my old topic died. Nobody ever helps me with this problem... :\ Yes, I tried searching, and No, I found no results. ^^"...

item.title: How would I go about adding some items?
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

duffy12345678910:

go into item.java and there you ill se number ids and you serch for helm or cape or watever you want to add and then you just write the item id there

  1. Nice gravedig.
  2. You didn’t need to post.
  3. Congratulations on using the search bar. I’ll give you credit for that.
  4. Read the last post’s date before posting on a searched answer topic.
  5. I don’t really need assistance with this anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: How would I go about adding some items?
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

Well, basically, I want THESE:

Added into my server properly. They’re IDs 7257-7281.
They equip as weapons, and I’m asking how I can put them coded in right… Not sure on how to, and the other answers didn’t help out much, since they’re somewhat coded in already. I’ll try adding them into item.cfg or item.java or whichever…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 29, 2009, 01:56:15 pm[/size][hr]Changed the ID names and crap to them, and nothing changed but the actual names. Lol.

Still need assistance >.>"

Read full topic

item.title: How would I go about adding some items?
item.dc:creator: @Stiflex Stiflex
item.description:
@Stiflex wrote:

lets say mod plate

if(i == 15075){ Jukkyname("Mod Platebody", "A moderator platebody."); class8.anIntArray156 = new int[8]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int [8]; Jukkycolors(61, 63, 0); Jukkycolors(24, 6073, 1); Jukkycolors(41, 63, 2); Jukkycolors(10394, 63, 3); Jukkycolors(10518, 6073, 4); Jukkycolors(10388, 6073, 5); Jukkycolors(10514, 6073, 6); Jukkycolors(10508, 6073, 7); Jukkyzoom(1380, 452, 0, 0, 0, -1, -1, -1, false); JukkyModels(6646, 3379, 6685, 3383, 2378); } add to class8.java if you want this change it to your wanted name but idk how to change the colour… soo you need to add the black/white/red/purple/green/ or blue trim armor like this…
well this is mine dont know if this will work on urs
